含义.解释: The character '休' primarily means 'to rest' or 'to cease'. It conveys the idea of taking a break or stopping an activity.

字形.描述: The character '休' is composed of two parts: the left part '亻' which is a variant of the radical meaning 'person', and the right part '木' which means 'tree'. Together, they depict a person resting under a tree.

字源.解释: The character '休' originates from ancient pictographs showing a person leaning against a tree, symbolizing rest. Over time, it evolved into its current form.

休息 (xiūxi) - to rest
休假 (xiūjià) - to take a vacation
休学 (xiūxué) - to take a leave of absence from school
休戚与共 (xiū qī yǔ gòng) - to share weal and woe
休养生息 (xiū yǎng shēng xī) - to recuperate and multiply
他决定休息一下。 (Tā juédìng xiūxi yīxià.) - He decided to take a rest.
今日事今日毕，明日休再提。 (Jīnrì shì jīnrì bì, míngrì xiū zài tí.) - Finish today's work today, and don't mention it tomorrow.

Once, a tired traveler found a large tree by the roadside. He sat under it to rest and soon fell asleep. When he woke up, he felt refreshed and continued his journey with renewed energy. This story illustrates the essence of '休' - taking a moment to rest can rejuvenate one's spirit.
